Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
@farl when it comes to safest, I count on the best security practice of the paranoids.
using a dedicated device, synced full node of that cryptocurrency which you have tokens of and which you value the most, compiled from source code, only command line and without any user interface, and only running this command line daemon on that machine and no use of any other software or service on that machine except this dedicated use. running it over tor + firewall setup, you can do simple commands for komodo like "sendtoaddress" to send the funds from your own address to your own address holding the funds, every month, to accrue and get rewards.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the less the other softwares there are on the OS which you are using for this cryptocurrency the less the chances of messing up and losing your valuable tokens.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and it's not that hard to setup this way.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: hmm.... I guess I can agree if a user is a linux newbie üòõ

Content: agree, will put in my todo list üòÉ

Content: That would be cool

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Paranoids just are crazy, there is kinda no end to it

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Yep, there is a fine balance between being safe and being so inconvenient that you dont want to do anything  üòÑ

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Exactly

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Well this is what i would suggest. Get the seed bip39 generator for komodo. On a offline PC have that there. Go to ledger, get the 24 words

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Punch that into the generator, you will get a list of addresses and privkeys

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Then every time you claim you check against your list to make sure the address that it generates you have the privkey for

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Maybe there is a way to point the blockchain data it uses to your own node too

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Then you should have the best of both worlds

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: When i say offline PC, i mean like never connected to the internet with wifi removed physically and a RJ45 cable chopped off and connected to the PC so you dont accidentally connect something.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Yes, that's also a good idea

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I was also thinking another thing

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: using libnspv as a replacement of full node on an offline computer

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: that means having a libnspv installed on a offline computer with network connections devices/parts removed physically.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: but to take the necessary data for libnspv from another online device and feed it to the the offline libnspv

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: check and view the basic transactions info from offline libnspv and create a signed transaction which you can take a copy of and braodcast from the online device using nspv

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @jl777c thoughts ?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I understand that there's no such data saved by libnspv on the disk, but only in the run time memory

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @blackjok3r

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: what if the data is saved to a removable device?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Like a USB, but once the USB touches the offline device it should be destroyed üòõ

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the reason I thought of libnspv as replacement for offline full node was the need to copy the GBs of data needed to copy from online device to an offline device to check on latest blockchain data to create a transaction.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: with libnspv, that will be in MBs

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @siu - Chainmakers - the app was just listed for pre-registrations recently which we removed. We are in the process of releasing version 0.1.7 this week which will become publicly available (as a public beta release). This will likely be the version for the first stress test stage. However, registered users are still able to download/install the app from playstore. Just DM us your playstore attached email address if that is not the case.
